t: Jeremiah 50
Judgment on Babylon and Babylonia
The*p word that the Lord*s spoke against Babylon and*i against the land of the Chaldeans by Jeremiah the prophet.

“Declare*pn among the nations, Proclaim,*ld and set up a standard; Proclaim—do*ld not conceal it—*i Say,*ld ‘Babylon is taken, Bel is shamed. Merodach*ld is broken in pieces; Her*ld idols are humiliated, Her*ld images are broken in pieces.’
For*ld out of the north a nation comes up against her, Which*ld shall make her land desolate, And*ld no one shall dwell therein. They*ld shall move, they shall depart, Both*ld man and beast.

“In*ln those days and in that time,” says the Lord,*s “The*ld children of Israel shall come, They*ld and the children of Judah together; With*ld continual weeping they shall come, And*ld seek the Lord*s their God.
They*ld shall ask the way to Zion, With*ld their faces toward it, saying,*i ‘Come*ld and let us join ourselves to the Lord*s In*ild a perpetual covenant That*ild will not be forgotten.’

“My*ln people have been lost sheep. Their*ld shepherds have led them astray; They*ld have turned them away on*i the mountains. They*ld have gone from mountain to hill; They*ld have forgotten their resting place.

All*ld who found them have devoured them; And*ld their adversaries said, ‘We have not offended, Because*ld they have sinned against the Lord,*s the habitation of justice, The*ld Lord,*s the hope of their fathers.’
“Move*ln from the midst of Babylon, Go*ld out of the land of the Chaldeans; And*ld be like the rams before the flocks.

For*ld behold, I will raise and cause to come up against Babylon An*ld assembly of great nations from the north country, And*ld they shall array themselves against her; From*ld there she shall be captured. Their*ld arrows shall*i be*i like those*i of an expert warrior; None*ld shall return in vain.
And*ld Chaldea shall become plunder; All*ld who plunder her shall be satisfied,” says the Lord.*s
“Because*ln you were glad, because you rejoiced, You*ld destroyers of My heritage, Because*ld you have grown fat like a heifer threshing grain, And*ld you bellow like bulls,
Your*ld mother shall be deeply ashamed; She*ld who bore you shall be ashamed. Behold,*ld the least of the nations shall*i be*i a wilderness, A*ld dry land and a desert.
Because*ld of the wrath of the Lord*s She*ld shall not be inhabited, But*ld she shall be wholly desolate. Everyone*ld who goes by Babylon shall be horrified And*ld hiss at all her plagues.
“Put*ln yourselves in array against Babylon all around, All*ld you who bend the bow; Shoot*ld at her, spare no arrows, For*ld she has sinned against the Lord.*s

Shout*ld against her all around; She*ld has given her hand, Her*ld foundations have fallen, Her*ld walls are thrown down; For*ld it is*i the vengeance of the Lord.*s Take*ld vengeance on her. As*ld she has done, so do to her.

Cut*ld off the sower from Babylon, And*ld him who handles the sickle at harvest time. For*ld fear of the oppressing sword Everyone*ld shall turn to his own people, And*ld everyone shall flee to his own land.
“Israel*ln is*i like scattered sheep; The*ld lions have driven him*i away. First*ld the king of Assyria devoured him; Now*ld at last this Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has broken his bones.”
Therefore*p thus says the Lord*s of hosts, the God of Israel: “Behold,*pn I will punish the king of Babylon and his land, As*ld I have punished the king of Assyria.
But*ld I will bring back Israel to his home, And*ld he shall feed on Carmel and Bashan; His*ld soul shall be satisfied on Mount Ephraim and Gilead.

In*ld those days and in that time,” says the Lord,*s “The*ld iniquity of Israel shall be sought, but there*i shall*i be*i none; And*ld the sins of Judah, but they shall not be found; For*ld I will pardon those whom I preserve.

“Go*ln up against the land of Merathaim, against it, And*ld against the inhabitants of Pekod. Waste*ld and utterly destroy them,” says the Lord,*s “And*ld do according to all that I have commanded you.
A*ld sound of battle is*i in the land, And*ld of great destruction.
How*ld the hammer of the whole earth has been cut apart and broken! How*ld Babylon has become a desolation among the nations!
I*ld have laid a snare for you; You*ld have indeed been trapped, O Babylon, And*ld you were not aware; You*ld have been found and also caught, Because*ld you have contended against the Lord.*s
The*ld Lord*s has opened His armory, And*ld has brought out the weapons of His indignation; For*ld this is*i the work of the Lord God*s of hosts In*ld the land of the Chaldeans.
Come*ld against her from the farthest border; Open*ld her storehouses; Cast*ld her up as heaps of ruins, And*ld destroy her utterly; Let*ld nothing of her be left.
Slay*ld all her bulls, Let*ld them go down to the slaughter. Woe*ld to them! For*ld their day has come, the time of their punishment.
The*ld voice of those who flee and escape from the land of Babylon Declares*ld in Zion the vengeance of the Lord*s our God, The*ld vengeance of His temple.

“Call*ln together the archers against Babylon. All*ld you who bend the bow, encamp against it all around; Let*ld none of them escape. Repay*ld her according to her work; According*ld to all she has done, do to her; For*ld she has been proud against the Lord,*s Against*ld the Holy One of Israel.
Therefore*ld her young men shall fall in the streets, And*ld all her men of war shall be cut off in that day,” says the Lord.*s
“Behold,*ld I am*i against you, O*ld most haughty one!” says the Lord God*s of hosts; “For*ld your day has come, The*ld time that*i I will punish you.
The*ld most proud shall stumble and fall, And*ld no one will raise him up; I*ld will kindle a fire in his cities, And*ld it will devour all around him.”

Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts: “The*pn children of Israel were*i oppressed, Along*ld with the children of Judah; All*ld who took them captive have held them fast; They*ld have refused to let them go.
Their*ld Redeemer is*i strong; The*ld Lord*s of hosts is*i His name. He*ld will thoroughly plead their case, That*ld He may give rest to the land, And*ld disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.
“A*ln sword is*i against the Chaldeans,” says the Lord,*s “Against*ld the inhabitants of Babylon, And*ld against her princes and her wise men.
A*ld sword is*i against the soothsayers, and they will be fools. A*ld sword is*i against her mighty men, and they will be dismayed.

A*ld sword is*i against their horses, Against*ld their chariots, And*ld against all the mixed peoples who are*i in her midst; And*ld they will become like women. A*ld sword is*i against her treasures, and they will be robbed.
A*ld drought is*i against her waters, and they will be dried up. For*ld it is*i the land of carved images, And*ld they are insane with their*i idols.

“Therefore*ln the wild desert beasts shall dwell there*i with the jackals, And*ld the ostriches shall dwell in it. It*ld shall be inhabited no more forever, Nor*ld shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation.
As*ld God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah And*ld their neighbors,” says the Lord,*s “So*ild no one shall reside there, Nor*ld son of man dwell in it.
“Behold,*ln a people shall come from the north, And*ld a great nation and many kings Shall*ld be raised up from the ends of the earth.

They*ld shall hold the bow and the lance; They*ld are*i cruel and shall not show mercy. Their*ld voice shall roar like the sea; They*ld shall ride on horses, Set*ld in array, like a man for the battle, Against*ld you, O daughter of Babylon.
“The*ln king of Babylon has heard the report about them, And*ld his hands grow feeble; Anguish*ld has taken hold of him, Pangs*ld as of a woman in childbirth.

“Behold,*ln he shall come up like a lion from the floodplain of the Jordan Against*ld the dwelling place of the strong; But*ld I will make them suddenly run away from her. And*ld who is*i a chosen man*i that*i I may appoint over her? For*ld who is*i like Me? Who*ld will arraign Me? And*ld who is*i that shepherd Who*ld will withstand Me?”

Therefore*ln hear the counsel of the Lord*s that He has taken against Babylon, And*ld His purposes that He has proposed against the land of the Chaldeans: Surely*ld the least of the flock shall draw them out; Surely*ld He will make their dwelling place desolate with them.
At*ld the noise of the taking of Babylon The*ld earth trembles, And*ld the cry is heard among the nations.
